snippet: Authorities anticipate capturing the architects of the JPMorgan Chase data breach, which they hope may turn the tide on such investigations, which often go unresolved.
abstract: Federal law enforcement officials are increasingly confident that they will be able to file criminal case against hackers who attacked JPMorgan Chase, which would break pattern of breaches of large American companies going unpunished; indictments and arrests would be victory for Preet Bharara, United States attorney in Manhattan, and for FBI.

byline.original: By MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN and NICOLE PERLROTH

lead_paragraph: Authorities anticipate capturing the architects of the JPMorgan Chase data breach, which they hope may turn the tide on such investigations, which often go unresolved.

headline.main: Authorities Closing In on Hackers Who Stole Data From JPMorgan Chase
headline.print_headline: Authorities Closing In on Hackers at Chase
